verse_commentaries.commentary: The triadic negation with progressive verbs (walked-stood-sat) creates an escalating sequence of moral corruption. The word אַשְׁרֵי (ashrei) is plural 'happinesses' not singular. Three distinct groups are specified: wicked (רְשָׁעִים), sinners (חַטָּאִים), and scoffers/insolent (לֵצִים), suggesting a taxonomy of evil.
figurative_analysis: walking/standing/sitting as metaphors for deepening involvement
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Establishes the negative boundary of righteous identity through systematic avoidance
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: 'ashrēy-hā'iysh 'asher  lō' hālakh baʿatsath rəshāʿiym wuvdherekh khatā'iym lō' ʿāmādh wuvmwōshav lētsiym lō' yāshāv

verse_commentaries.commentary: Sharp contrast marker כִּי אִם creates emphatic opposition. The verb חֶפְצוֹ (delight) suggests emotional pleasure, not mere duty. הֶהְגֶּה (meditate) has broader semantic range including 'mutter/growl' - possibly audible study. יוֹמָם וָלָיְלָה is meristic for totality.
figurative_analysis: day and night as totality of existence
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Positive counterpart establishing Torah as organizing principle of righteous existence
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: kiy 'im-bəthwōrath yəhōwāh kheftswō wuvthwōrāthwō yehgeh ywōmām wālāyəlāh

verse_commentaries.commentary: Extended metaphor with precise agricultural imagery. שָׁתוּל (transplanted) implies deliberate placement, not natural growth. עַל־פַּלְגֵי־מָיִם suggests irrigation channels. Three-part blessing: fruit in season, unfading leaves, universal success (יַצְלִיחַ).
figurative_analysis: tree as metaphor for righteous person
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Creation imagery suggests righteous life aligns with divine order embedded in nature
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: wəhāyāh kəʿēts shāthwul ʿal-palghēy-māyim 'asher pirywō  yitēn bəʿituwō wəʿālēhwu lō'-yibuwōl wəkhōl 'asher-yaʿaseh yatsliykha

verse_commentaries.commentary: Abrupt transition with לֹא־כֵן (not so). Single metaphor contrasts with elaborate tree imagery - stark asymmetry. מֹץ (chaff) is agricultural waste. Wind (רוּחַ) as active agent of removal. Economy of description suggests transience.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Natural imagery continues but shows cosmic order rejecting wickedness

verse_commentaries.commentary: עַל־כֵּן (therefore) marks logical consequence. יָקֻמוּ (stand/arise) has legal connotations - judicial standing. מִשְׁפָּט can mean judgment process or verdict. עֲדַת צַדִּיקִים suggests eschatological community assembly.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Moves from individual piety to communal/cosmic judgment dimension
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: ʿal-kēn  lō'-yāqumwu rəshāʿiym bamishpāt wəkhatā'iym baʿadhath tsadiyqiym

verse_commentaries.commentary: יוֹדֵעַ (knows) suggests intimate knowledge, not mere awareness. דֶּרֶךְ (way) appears twice - structural parallelism. תֹּאבֵד (perish) is active destruction, not passive fading. Asymmetric parallel: YHWH knows righteous way, but wicked way simply perishes - no agent specified for destruction.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Culminates in divine omniscience as foundation of moral order - YHWH's knowledge sustains righteousness
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: kiy-ywōdhēʿa yəhōwāh derekh tsadiyqiym wədherekh rəshāʿiym tō'vēdh f

thematic_threads: Progressive involvement pattern: walk→stand→sit parallels increasing moral corruption
Asymmetric treatment: elaborate blessing imagery vs compressed judgment imagery
Agricultural metaphors throughout: counsel/path/seat → tree/chaff → streams/wind
Temporal progression: present behavior → ongoing blessing → future judgment → eternal destinies
Divine name progression: absent (v1) → YHWH central (v2) → implied (vv3-5) → YHWH decisive (v6)
interesting_questions: Why does the psalm use שָׁתוּל (transplanted) rather than נָטַע (planted) - what theological significance does deliberate relocation have?
What is the semantic range of יֶהְגֶּה (meditate/mutter) and does it suggest audible Torah study practices?
Why the stark asymmetry between elaborate tree blessing (3 elements) and compressed chaff curse (1 element)?
How does the progression walk→stand→sit function psychologically and morally in wisdom literature?
What is the relationship between YHWH 'knowing' the righteous way and the wicked way 'perishing' - why no divine agent for destruction?
Why three distinct categories of evildoers (wicked, sinners, scoffers) rather than generic opposition?
What does עֲדַת צַדִּיקִים (assembly of righteous) suggest about eschatological community formation?
synthesis_notes:
LEXICON: Focus on יֶהְגֶּה semantic field, שָׁתוּל vs נָטַע, יוֹדֵעַ theological usage
CONCORDANCE: Track progressive verb sequences in wisdom literature, עֲדַת formations, דֶּרֶךְ in moral contexts
FIGURATIVE: All agricultural metaphors, especially tree/water/fruit imagery in Torah contexts
COMMENTARY: Asymmetric parallelism patterns, eschatological judgment vocabulary, Torah meditation practices
